title: Adjust location update cadence to 12s and SOS radius copy to 30m (frontend)

requirements.summary: Update all periodic location update/poll intervals to 12 seconds and align any UI text that mentions the update frequency.
acceptanceCriteria: Ambulance location updates are sent to the backend every 12 seconds (not 3).
Police location updates are sent to the backend every 12 seconds (not 3).
Police-side polling for nearby ambulance locations runs every 12 seconds (not 3).
Any UI copy that states the update frequency reflects 12 seconds (e.g., badges/instructions).

file_operations.description: Change the ambulance location sending interval constant from 3s to 12s (e.g., LOCATION_UPDATE_INTERVAL = 12000) and ensure any inline comments/UI copy that explicitly mentions the old 3-second cadence is updated to match 12 seconds. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Change police location sending interval from 3s to 12s (e.g., POLICE_LOCATION_UPDATE_INTERVAL = 12000) and update any visible UI copy (e.g., the monitoring badge text) that mentions live updates every 3s so it reflects 12s. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update the React Query polling interval used for police-side refreshing of nearby ambulance locations to 12 seconds (refetchInterval for useGetLocationsInRadius). Keep unrelated radii (e.g., RADIUS_KM=1.0) unchanged. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update SOS targeting radius references in the ambulance UI from 20m to 30m (frontend copy changes only in this plan).
acceptanceCriteria: Backend SOS targeting filters police within 30 meters (0.03 km) instead of 20 meters (0.02 km).
Ambulance UI SOS status text and "How it works" bullet(s) reference 30 meters (not 20).
Behaviorally, a police unit at ~25m can be selected/targeted, while one at ~35m is not (assuming both have recent locations).

file_operations.description: Update ambulance-side SOS UI copy to reference 30 meters instead of 20 meters (e.g., the active SOS alert text and the relevant "How it works" bullet). Do not change SOS duration or the number of police units referenced (keep nearest 2). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
